description.en: Plastic in the ocean is a threat to marine wildlife and can enter the global food chains. This map shows the modelled plastic concentration based on measurements from 24 expeditions. Darker colours indicate more floating plastic debris.

description.en: This map layer shows estimates of mismanaged plastic waste per km<sup>2</sup>, that were derived using GDP and population data. Darker colours indicate higher amounts of mismanaged waste that can enter our environment.

description.en: Wind and rain carry plastic waste into our streams and rivers. This layer shows the estimated amount of plastic waste entering our oceans for the 122 most polluting rivers. Larger circles indicate more emissions.
